summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to a Colonel (likely a corrections official) regarding Jeffrey Epstein's work release arrangement. The email raises concerns about inconsistencies in Epstein's statements about his employment at the Florida Science Foundation and questions whether his proposed work release activities align with the objectives of imprisonment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email; his plea agreement and proposed work release arrangement are being discussed, with concerns raised about the veracity of his statements regarding his employment.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: His office suite is listed as the address for the Florida Science Foundation, which Epstein claimed as his place of employment for work release.

persons.name: Colonel

connections.description: Epstein's proposed work release location is Goldberger's office suite, which is listed as the address for the Florida Science Foundation.
The Colonel, as a corrections official, has discretionary authority over Epstein's work release application, which the email writer is attempting to influence.

events.title: Meeting Regarding Epstein's Work Release
events.description: A meeting occurred on the Tuesday prior to this email (July 1, 2008) between the email writer and the Colonel to discuss Jeffrey Epstein's case and work release.

events.title: Change of Plea Hearing
events.description: Epstein stated during his change of plea that he would be working at the Florida Science Foundation, which he claimed had existed for a couple of years and where he worked 'every day' prior to the plea.

events.title: Incorporation of Florida Science Foundation
events.description: The Florida Science Foundation was incorporated, contradicting Epstein's claim that it had existed for 'a couple of years' at the time of his plea in 2008.

locations: 250 Australian Avenue, Suite 1400, Palm Beach County, FL
keyFacts: The email reveals significant discrepancies in Jeffrey Epstein's statements to the court: he claimed to work 'every day' at the Florida Science Foundation, which he said had existed for 'a couple of years,' but state records showed it was incorporated only in November 2007.

The address for the Florida Science Foundation was Jack Goldberger's law office suite, and there was no physical evidence (building directory, suite door, tenant knowledge) that such a business operated there.
Epstein had not been in Palm Beach County in the six months prior to the email, contradicting his claim of working there 'every day.'

The Assistant U.S. Attorney expresses concern that Epstein's proposed work release—in his attorney's office suite making calls, web-surfing, and having food delivered—does not align with the objectives of imprisonment.
The email attaches a portion of Epstein's non-prosecution agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office, indicating ongoing legal negotiations and oversight of his sentence.
